Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon More Crop Formations in England © 2001 by Linda Moulton Howe May 31, 2001 Southern England - Since May 12 when a farmer near Warnford, Hampshire found a flattened circle surrounded by rings in his yellow flowering oilseed rape, there have been four more reported in the counties of Dorset, Wiltshire and Hertfordshire. May 2001 May 12, 2001 - Double ringed circle, 100 feet diameter, oilseed rape, at Old Winchester Hill near Warnford, Hampshire. Aerial photograph © 2001 by David Russell. May 19, 2001 - Sevenfold pattern inside circle, 152 feet diameter, oilseed rape, at the end of the Bournemouth International Airport in Hurn near Christchurch, Dorset.

Aerial photographs © 2001 by Steve Alexander, http://www.temporarytemples.co.uk May 25, 2001 - Simple circle, perhaps 8 feet diameter, with double grapeshot near perimeter, oilseed rape, close to the slopes of the Pewsey White Horse in Wiltshire. Aerial Photograph © 2001 by Peter Sorensen. May 27, 2001 - Complex triangle pattern inside circle, appx. 150 feet diameter, barley, Berranburgh field below RAF hospital near Burderop, Hackpen and Barbury Castle, Wiltshire. Aerial photograph © 2001 by Peter R. Sorensen. May 28, 2001 - "Scarab beetle with sun" motif, Pegsdon about 3 miles west of Hitchin, Hertfordshire. No photograph available yet.
